de.feig.FEDM.Core.TagHandler

Class TH_ISO14443_4_MIFARE_DESFire_SamCrypto

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.feig.FEDM.Core.TagHandler.TH_ISO14443_4_MIFARE_DESFire_SamCrypto

  • public class TH_ISO14443_4_MIFARE_DESFire_SamCrypto
extends java.lang.Object
    Transponder class, nested in class TH_ISO14443_4_MIFARE_DESFire, providing manufacturer specific commands for ISO 14443-4 compliant Transponders of type MIFARE DESFire from manufacturer NXP Semiconductors.

    Description:
    High-level class for easy-to-use Transponder specific communication. See OBID::FEDM::Core::ITagGroup for additional information.
    This class implements the communication with [0xC3] Reader commands and internal SAM crypto commands.
    Detailed description about the command interface can be found in:
    - Product Datasheet for MIFARE DESFire from NXP Semiconductors
    - System Manual SAMCrypto Functions from FEIG ELECTRONIC

    Note: Programmers should be familiar with the ISO 14443 and ISO/IEC 7816 standards.

      • authenticate

        public int authenticate(byte samSlotNo,
                        byte desFireAuthMode,
                        byte desFireKeyNo,
                        byte samAuthMode,
                        byte samKeyNo,
                        byte samKeyVersion,
                        byte[] samDiversificationInput)
                 throws FeException
        DESFire command [0x0A] Authenticate or [0x1A] AuthenticateISO or [0xAA] AuthenticateAES, realized with Reader command [0xC3][0xFA] Authent
        Parameters:
        samSlotNo -
        desFireAuthMode -
        desFireKeyNo -
        samAuthMode -
        samKeyNo -
        samKeyVersion -
        samDiversificationInput -
        Returns:
        operation status
        • 0 if OK
        • > 0 status byte of the responded protocol, if the Reader signals a problem. See Reader's System Manual for the full list with all status bytes
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)
        Description:
        This method is a security related command.
        Detailed description about the command and the parameters can be found in:
        - Product Datasheet for MIFARE DESFire from NXP Semiconductors
        - System Manual SAMCrypto Functions from FEIG ELECTRONIC
